SENT.plain: The authors present a case of probable amphetamine-induced cerebral arteritis in a 31-year-old man with AIDS, testicular carcinoma, and recurrent pneumocystis pneumonia
MR enhancement was demonstrated in areas of focal arterial ectasia, presumably due to slow flow
CT, MR, and angiographic findings were strikingly confirmed postmortem
Angiography remains essential in the diagnosis of cerebral arteritis
